tweet: I look forward to leading important work in the House of Representatives to reaffirm our NATO membership and am confident that oversight over President Trump's impulsive decisions on this critical security issue will be vigorously pursued here in Congress.

Withdrawing from NATO would create one of the most dangerous security voids of our lifetimes serving only to empower those who would strive to weaken the United States and undermine the world order the we have spent the last half of the twentieth century building with our allies.

NATO is a cornerstone of our efforts to keep Americans safe here at home and let us not forget that NATO Article 5 has only been invoked once in its history - in the collective defense of the United States after 9/11.

The President's willingness to discard our longstanding NATO alliance without consulting Congress or our allies is disturbing. That there was discussion of this prospect alone is alarming, damages our credibility with our European allies, and leaves us less secure.
I am proud to join on as a co-sponsor of #HR8 today and stand with all survivors of gun violence whose lives might be different had we had smart gun laws already in place.

Rep. Giffords was also in Washington for the announcement of H.R. 8 – “To require a background check for every firearm sale” which was introduced by a bipartisan group of five Democrats and five Republicans.

Gabby is a hero – and it was my great honor to be able to convey that message this morning when I spoke with her outside the newly-dedicated Gabrielle Giffords-Leo J. Ryan Cloakroom at the Capitol. pic.twitter.com/fqBfRXKZLb

In the years since that awful Saturday in January, our nation has had a front row seat to see how special Rep. Giffords truly is. Her recovery has been an inspiration, and she has been a leader in the fight for sensible gun reform.

I had only been in Congress for 5 days when @GabbyGiffords was shot while meeting with constituents. I hadn’t had the chance to get to know her yet, but I immediately learned from other Members who knew her well what a committed legislator and thoughtful colleague she is.
The reality of the #TrumpShutdown is that the DHS, TSA, and DOJ employees responsible for protecting us are working without pay because the White House is placing politics ahead of our safety.

2,170 people whose names were in the Terrorist Screening Database were encountered at U.S. airports in 2018. 2,265 people on this list purchased firearms between 2004 and 2015. #TrumpShutdown pic.twitter.com/OJotM3v72I

The Department of Homeland Security has many responsibilities and contributing to the Terrorist Screening Database is one of them. This is the database that TSA uses for the “No-Fly List” and the database that the Department of Justice checks against gun purchases. #TrumpShutdown

On a personal note, I was excited to return to Washington this week for the first time since my successful eye surgery last month. I am very grateful for the outpouring of well wishes from constituents.

Serving the Commonwealth and our nation is one of the greatest privileges of my life and I’m looking forward to working during the 116th Congress to advance the interests important to Southeastern Bay Staters and citizens across the country.

I was proud to join the new majority in voting to re-open the government and I am also proud to support and co-sponsor HR 1. These two pieces of legislation are what the citizens of this county want. It is the message they sent in November.

Thursday was a great day for our nation - Speaker Pelosi took the gavel to preside over a new majority and the most diverse Congress in history with her grandchildren and the children of many other members by her side. I was able to grab this picture from my seat on the floor. pic.twitter.com/sIOZ2QeQD5
